{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chronic gingival inflammation is primarily caused by the accumulation of dental plaque and the body's immune response to it. Neutrophils, macrophages, T-lymphocytes, and plasma cells are all involved in the immune response and can contribute to chronic gingival inflammation. Therefore, none of these options are not responsible for chronic gingival inflammation.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
